meanings.definition: To give up or hand over control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: He surrenders his toy to his little sister.
meanings.sent2: The soldier surrenders his weapon to the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The cat surrenders the chase to the nimble mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun surrenders its warmth to the cool night.
meanings.sent5: She surrenders her seat to the elderly lady.

meanings.definition: To yield to the power, control, or possession of another.
meanings.sent1: The defeated team surrenders to the champions.
meanings.sent2: The king surrenders his crown to the new ruler.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock finally surrenders to the key's twist.
meanings.sent4: The river surrenders to the force of the waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The tree surrenders its leaves to the autumn breeze.

meanings.definition: The act of surrendering or giving up.
meanings.sent1: His surrender was a sign of peace.
meanings.sent2: The treaty included the surrender of territories.
meanings.sent3: The cat's surrender of the mouse was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The surrender of power led to a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: Her surrender of the argument ended the debate.
